channel.title: Where do you buy your games?
channel.description:
Where do you guys buy your games?
Can you trust website like http://www.cjs-cdkeys.com/ or http://www.keys4.me ???

item.title: Where do you buy your games?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:12, topic:382480”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=478274.msg3500796#msg3500796 date=1297721847]
I usually grab them from the $5 bin at Wal-mart or Odd Lots.
[/quote]I can never do that, I always need them when the first come out.[/quote]

I’ve only ever bought 2 games when they first came out, and I went to my local Best Buy for that. They were ‘Doom 3’ and ‘Battlefield: Vietnam’.

All the rest of the games I have I bought long after they were released.

Read full topic
item.source: Where do you buy your games?

item.title: Where do you buy your games?
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:8, topic:382480”][quote author=sppt link=topic=478274.msg3500503#msg3500503 date=1297697742]
I generally buy from g2play.net, they’ve got a pretty decent selection, and the service is excellent!
If a key doesn’t work, they’ll send you a new one, and all that.
I think I bought like 10-15 games there in total, for myself and friends, and never had any major problems with them!

PS: Stay away from cjs-cdkeys!
[/quote]
g2play.net is very cheap. I might buy bad company 2 from them.

What’s wrong with cjs-cdkeys?[/quote]
Comic Sans MS, that’s what’s wrong!

Read full topic
item.source: Where do you buy your games?

I think I bought like 10-15 games there in total, for myself and friends, and never had any major problems with them!

@tL wrote:

Steam

shopto.net

ShopTo | Video Games | Home Entertainment | TVs | Laptops | Tablets | Cycling

Buy and Pre-order video games, home entertainment, TVs, laptops, tablets, cycling and sports technology. Free UK Delivery. Finance available

Pretty much exclusively.

item.description:
@sppt wrote:

I generally buy from g2play.net, they’ve got a pretty decent selection, and the service is excellent!
If a key doesn’t work, they’ll send you a new one, and all that.
I think I bought like 10-15 games there in total, for myself and friends, and never had any major problems with them!

PS: Stay away from cjs-cdkeys!

item.title: Where do you buy your games?
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Baros Rocks, post:4, topic:382480”]Usually Steam as I’m lazy, although some games can be overpriced so I’ll check Amazon or something.

It’s very rare I buy from real shop, if I do it’s usually because I’m passing, being more of an impulse buy than anything.[/quote]

Wow amazon.com is relatively cheap.

Read full topic
